Downward Dog

Downward Dog, or 'Adho Mukha Svanasana', is one of the most recognized and widely practiced yoga poses. It provides a full-body stretch, lengthening the spine, strengthening the arms and legs, and engaging the core. This foundational pose energizes the body and can help improve circulation, making it a great transitional pose in yoga flows. Whether you're using it as a warm-up or cool-down, Downward Dog helps to release tension from the back and shoulders while improving flexibility in the hamstrings and calves.
